document.masterDocTitle: New species, new records and checklist of cicadas from Mexico (Hemiptera: Cicadomorpha: Cicadidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species, new records and checklist of cicadas from Mexico (Hemiptera: Cicadomorpha: Cicadidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Odopoea azteca
Distant, 1881
. The species is only known from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Odopoea minuta
sp.n.
The species is only known from the type series collected in Colima.

Odopoea signoreti
Stål, 1864
. The species is known from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
) and Honduras (
Sanborn 2006 b
). The author has identified specimens from Veracruz.

Zammara calochroma
Walker, 1858
. The species ranges from Mexico to Ecuador (
Metcalf 1963 a
,
Sanborn 2006 a
). Mexican specimens have been collected in Veracruz (
Stål, 1864
), Tamaulipas and San Luis Potosi (
Sanborn 2006 a
).

Zammara smaragdina
Walker, 1850
. This species ranges from Mexico to Ecuador (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
,
Sanborn 2006 b
, Sanborn 2007 ). Mexican specimens have been reported from Tabasco and southern Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Zammara smaragdula
Walker, 1858
. The species was incorrectly synonymized with
Z. calochroma
by
Metcalf ( 1963 a)
. The species ranges from Mexico (
Sanborn 2006 a
), Guatemala (
Sanborn 2006 b
), and Costa Rica (Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
) into South America (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Mexican specimens were collected in Chiapas and Veracruz (
Sanborn 2006 a
).

Chinaria mexicana
Davis, 1934
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). It has been collected in Morelos, Guerrero, Sinaloa, Nayarit and Michoacán (
Davis 1934
,
Davis 1942
). The author has also identified specimens from Jalisco.

Chinaria pueblaensis
sp. n.
The species is only known from the type location in the state of Puebla.

Chinaria similis
Davis, 1942
. The species is only known from Guerrero (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Diceroprocta alacris campechensis
Davis, 1938
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The type series was collected in Campeche (
Davis 1938
).

Diceroprocta albomaculata
Davis, 1928
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Specimens were collected in San Luis Potosi and Veracruz (
Davis 1928
,
Davis 1941
).

Diceroprocta apache (Davis, 1921 )
. The species is reported from Arizona , California, Utah, Colorado, Nevada and Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
). The author has identified specimens from Baja California Norte.

Diceroprocta arizona (Davis, 1916 )
. The species has been reported from Arizona and Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The author has identified specimens from Chiapas, Durango and Sinaloa.

Diceroprocta azteca (Kirkaldy, 1909 )
. The species has been described from Mexico , Texas, Oklahoma, and Aragua, Venezuela (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
). The Venezuelan specimens appear to be geographically isolated and need to be reexamined to confirm their identity (Sanborn 2007 ). It has been reported from Nuevo León, Tamaulipas and Michoacán in Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Diceroprocta bicolora
Davis, 1935
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The type series was collected in Morelos, Puebla and Manzanillo (probably Veracruz) (
Davis 1935
).

Diceroprocta bicosta (
Walker, 1850
)
. The species is reported from Mexico , Costa Rica , Honduras and El Salvador (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
,
Sanborn 2006 b
) with erroneous records from the United States (
Metcalf 1963 a
). It has been reported from Michoacán, Puebla, Morelos, Jalisco and Sonora (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Diceroprocta cinctifera viridicosta
Davis, 1930
new record . The UMMZ has specimens collected in Nuevo León, 40 miles NE of China ,
5 –VI– 1967
. The species has previously been reported from Texas (
Metcalf 1963 a
,
Sanborn & Phillips 1996
).

Diceroprocta delicata (Osborn, 1906 )
. The species is known from Louisiana, Texas, and Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
,
Sanborn & Phillips 2001
). The author has identified specimens from Nuevo León, Tamaulipas and Puebla collected in Mexico .

Diceroprocta distanti Metcalf, 1963
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Diceroprocta eugraphica (Davis, 1916 )
. The species is found across much of the western United States (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
). It has been reported from Chihuahua in Mexico (
Sanborn 2006 a
).

Diceroprocta fraterna
Davis, 1935
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The type series was collected in Nayarit (
Davis 1935
). The author has identified specimens from the Yucatán, Guerrero, and Puebla.

Diceroprocta lucida
Davis, 1934
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The type series was collected in Morelos (
Davis 1934
).

Diceroprocta marevagans
Davis, 1928
. The species has been reported from Texas and Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Mexican specimens are reported from Tamaulipas (
Davis 1930
). The species is probably found along the eastern coast between Veracruz and Texas. It is restricted to coastal habitats.

Diceroprocta oculata
Davis, 1935
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The type series was collected in Nayarit (
Davis 1935
).

Diceroprocta operculabrunnea
Davis, 1934
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The type series was collected in Morelos (
Davis 1934
). The author has also identified specimens from Puebla.

Diceroprocta oaxacaenis
sp. n.
The species is only known from the type series collected in Oaxaca.

Diceroprocta pronotolinea
sp. n.
The species is only known from the type series collected in Guerrero.

Diceroprocta semicincta (Davis, 1925 )
. The species has been reported from Arizona , New Mexico and Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The author has identified specimens from Nayarit, Sinaloa and Sonora.

Diceroprocta swalei (
Distant, 1904
)
new record .
Distant ( 1904 )
considered the species probably originating in Central America . It has been reported from Arizona (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The LACM has specimens from Sonora, Adriana, 5 miles West of Alames,
12 –VI– 1961
. The CASC has specimens from Sonora, San Bernardino, Rio Mayo,
24 –VI–1935
, 25–VI–1935 ,
26–VI– 1935
, and
29 –VI- 1935
; and Sonora Bakachaka, Rio Mayo,
4 –VII– 1935
.

Diceroprocta tepicana
Davis, 1938
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Specimens were collected in Nayarit (
Davis 1938
). The author has also identified specimens from Sinaloa, Jalisco and Oaxaca.

Diceroprocta texana lata
Davis, 1941
. The species has previously been reported only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
) but there are references to Texas specimens after the original species description in
Davis ( 1941 )
. The type series was collected in Nuevo León (
Davis 1941
). The author has also identified specimens from Tamaulipas, Nuevo León and Coahuila.

Tibicen chihuahuaensis
sp. n.
The species is only known from the type series collected in Chihuahua.

Tibicen chiricahua Davis, 1923
new record . The UNSM has a specimen from Chihuahua, 20 miles Southeast of Columbus,
8 –VI– 1982
. The species has previously been reported from Arizona and New Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The southern extension into Mexico is not surprising as the author has collected examples within site of the Mexico-Arizona border.

Tibicen chisosensis
Davis, 1934
new record . The AMNH has a specimen from Chihuahua, Matachic,
7 – VII– 1947
. This record represents an approximately 475 km range extension to the west for the species which has previously been reported only from the Chisos Mountains of Texas (
Davis 1934
,
Phillips & Sanborn 2007
). Matachic appears to be within the Sierra Madre Occidental of the Madrean floristic region (
Peet 1988
). There should be suitable habitat in the area if the specimen was collected in the mountains on either side of the valley containing Matachic. The species has been associated with Mexican pinyon pine (
Pinus cembroides Newberry
) (
Phillips & Sanborn 2007
) which is present in the Madrean floristic province (
Peet 1988
).

Tibicen cultriformis (Davis, 1915 )
new record . The SEMC has specimens from Sonora, 11 miles West of Imuria,
26 –IX– 1958
. The species was previously known from Arizona (
Metcalf 1963 a
) and New Mexico (Sanborn unpublished). It is not surprising to extend the range of the species into Mexico as the author has collected specimens within a few kilometers of the Arizona-Mexico border.

Tibicen distanti Metcalf, 1963
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Tibicen fuscus
Davis, 1934
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The type was collected in Distrito Federal (
Davis 1934
).

Tibicen hidalgoensis
Davis, 1941
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Specimens were collected in Hidalgo (
Davis 1941
).

Tibicen minor
Davis, 1934
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Specimens were collected in Distrito Federal and Jalisco (
Davis 1934
).

Tibicen oleacea (
Distant, 1891
)
.
Distant ( 1900 )
mistakenly synonymized this species to
T. nigiventris
. The author has seen representatives of both species and was able to separate them based on the original species descriptions, particularly based on the size of the pronotum and coloration patterns. The figures in
Distant ( 1881
,
1900
) also facilitate the separation of two species. The author has identified specimens from Oaxaca and Veracruz.

Tibicen paralleloides
Davis, 1934
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Specimens were collected in Nayarit, Sinaloa and Jalisco (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Tibicen robustus
Distant, 1881
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Mexican specimens were reported from Morelos and Puebla (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Tibicen sugdeni
Davis, 1941
. The species is known only from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The type series is from Nuevo León (
Davis 1941
).

Cornuplura nigroalbata (
Davis, 1936
)
new record . The CASC has specimens from Sonora, Bakachaka, Rio Mayo. Collection dates are
3 –VII–1935
,
4–VII– 1935
and
6 –VII– 1935
. The species was previously only reported from Arizona (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The extension of this species into Mexico is not a surprise as the author has collected specimens within a couple kilometers of the Arizona-Mexico border.

Cornuplura rudis (
Walker, 1858
)
. The species has been reported from Mexico and Arizona (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The Arizona reports are considered to be
C. nigroalbata (
Davis, 1936
)
.
Cornuplura rudis
has been reported from Veracruz, Morelos, Distrito Federal, and Eastern Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The author has also identified specimens from Chihuahua.

Cacama californica
Davis, 1919
new record . The SDMC has specimens from Baja California Norte, Sangre de Cristo,
VI– 1927
. The LACM has specimens from Baja California Norte, 13 miles East of Valle de Trinidad ,
26 –V– 1968
; Baja California Norte, 1 mile South of Rosarito,
29 –VI– 1976
. The southern extension from Southern California is not surprising. The species has previously been reported from California (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Cacamam carbonaria
Davis, 1919
. This species is only known from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). It has been reported from Morelos (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The author has also identified specimens from Oaxaca and Michoacán.

Cacama dissimilis (
Distant, 1881
)
. This species has been reported from Mexico , Texas and Arizona (
Metcalf 1963 a
). However, the Arizona specimens actually represent a new species (Sanborn et al. unpublished) and the Texas report appears to be erroneous as we have never encountered
C. dissimilis
in Texas nor found
C. dissimilis
collected in Texas in visits to more than 100 entomological collections.
Cacama dissimilis
is considered to be a Mexican species. It has been reported from Baja California Sur, Espiritu Santo Island and Ballanda Island (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The author has identified specimens from Hidalgo and Sinaloa.

Cacama furcata
Davis, 1919
. The species is only known from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Specimens were tentatively reported to be collected in Lower California (
Davis 1919
). The author has identified specimens from Baja California Sur and Tamaulipas.

Cacama valvata (Uhler, 1888 )
. The species is reported to inhabit Arizona , California, Colorado, New Mexico , Texas, Utah, Oklahoma and Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
). The author has identified specimens from Chihuahua, Coahuila, Durango, Nuevo León, Sonora and Veracruz.

Cacama variegata
Davis, 1919
new record . The UMMZ has specimens from Cohuila, Sierra de la Garcia pass, 4000 ’,
29 –VII- 1959
; Durango, 3 miles East of Conejas,
25 –VI– 1958
; Nuevo Leon, Monterey,
20 – VI–1957
,
5–IV– 1957
and
V– 1953
; Tamaulipas, Victoria,
30 –V- 1965
; and Tamaulipas, Santa Teresa,
15 –V– 1952
. The EMEC has a specimen from Nuevo Leon, Vallecito,
2–5 –VI– 1951
. The MTEC has a female from Nuevo Leon, Huasteca Canyon,
17 –VI– 1982
. The author ( AFSC ) has specimens from Tamaulipas, 18 miles south of Laredo, Texas,
17 –VI– 1965
and Tamaulipas, 80 miles NE of Ciudad Victoria,
13 –VI– 1965
. The species has been recorded previously only from southern Texas (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The new records expand the species distribution across northeastern Mexico .

Proarna hilaris (Germar, 1834 )
. The species has been reported from Mexico , Caribbean islands (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
) and Venezuela (Sanborn 2007 ).

Proarna insignis
Distant, 1881
. A widespread species reported from Mexico , Honduras , Guatemala , Nicaragua , Panama , French Guiana , Colombia , Venezuela , Ecuador , Peru , Brazil , Argentina , and Central and South America (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
,
Sanborn 2006 b
).

Proarna olivieri Metcalf, 1963
. A species previously reported from Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica , Brazil , Venezuela , Guyana , Surinam , French Guiana , Trindad and Tobago , Jamaica , Cuba , and Central and South America (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
,
Sanborn 2006 b
, Sanborn 2007 ).

Proarna pulverea (Olivier, 1790 )
. The species has been reported from Mexico , Surinam , Brazil , Uruguay , Argentina , and South America (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The Mexican specimens appear to be separated from the remaining locations and their status needs to be re-evaluated. It has been reported from Veracruz (
Stål 1864
,
Distant 1881
).

Proarna sallaei
Stål, 1864
. The species is known from Mexico , Costa Rica , and Honduras (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
,
Sanborn 2006 b
). It has been collected in Veracruz, Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The author has identified specimens from Oaxaca and Chiapas as well.

Beameria wheeleri
Davis, 1934
. The species is known only from southern New Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
) and Chihuahua (
Sanborn 2006 a
).

Ollanta mexicana
Distant, 1905
. The species is only known from Veracruz (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Ollanta modesta
Distant, 1881
. The species is known from Mexico , Nicaragua and Central America (
Metcalf 1963 a
). Mexican specimens were reported from Morelos (
Metcalf 1963 a
).

Pacarina puella Davis, 1923
. The species is known from Mexico , Guatemala , Central America , Texas, Oklahoma, and Arizona (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
). It has been reported in Veracruz, Nuevo León and Tamaulipas in Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). The author has also identified specimens from San Luis Potosí.

Pacarina schumanni
Distant, 1905
. The species was described from Veracruz (
Distant 1905
). It has been reported from Mexico , Belize , Honduras and El Salvador (
Metcalf 1963 a
,
Sanborn 2001 a
,
Sueur 2002
,
Sanborn 2006 b
).

Fidicinoides compostela
Davis, 1934
comb. n.
The species is here assigned to
Fidicinoides
based on the generic characters outlined by Boulard & Martinelli ( 1996 ), i.e. the small lateral metascutellar plates, the small dorso-lateral opening to the timbal chamber, and the eyes not exceeding the breadth of the suprahumeral lobes of the pronotum. The species is only known from Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 a
). It is described from Nayarit (
Davis 1934
) and the author has identified specimens from Colima.

Fidicinoides determinata (
Walker, 1858
)
. The species has also been described from Venezuela Mexico , Guatemala , Honduras , and El Salvador (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Boulard & Martinelli 1996 ,
Sanborn 2001 a
,
Sanborn 2006 a
, Sanborn 2007 ). It has been reported from Veracruz (Boulard & Martinelli 1996 ) and the author has specimens from Jalisco and Nayarit in Mexico .

Fidicinoides picea (
Walker, 1850
)
. The species is described from Mexico , Central America , Panama , Guyana , Brazil , Venezuela , Colombia , and Ecuador (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Boulard & Martinelli 1996 , Sanborn 2007 ). It has been reported from Veracruz (Boulard & Martinelli 1996 ,
Sueur 2002
) in Mexico .

Fidicinoides pronoe (
Walker, 1850
)
. A Neotropical species is reported from Mexico , Honduras , El Salvador , Guatemala , Costa Rica , Panama , Colombia , Venezuela , Ecuador , Peru , Brazil , Trinidad and Tobago , and Central and South America (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
, Boulard & Martinelli 1996 ,
Sanborn 2001 a
,
Sanborn 2006 b
, Sanborn 2007 ). It has been reported in Oaxaca (
Moore 1962
) and Veracruz (
Sueur 2002
) in Mexico .

Dorisiana sutori
Sueur, 2000
. The species is only known from Veracruz (
Sueur 2000
,
Sueur 2002
) and specimens identified by the author collected in Chiapas.

Quesada gigas (Olivier, 1790 )
. Probably the species with the greatest range in the New World extending from central Argentina to the southern United States (
Metcalf 1963 a
, Duffels & van der
Laan 1985
,
Sanborn 2001 a
,
Sueur 2002
,
Sanborn 2006 b
, Sanborn 2007 ).

Neocicada australamexicana
Sanborn & Sueur, 2005
. The species is known only from the type series collected at various locations in Veracruz and Chiapas (
Sanborn et al. 2005
).

Neocicada chisos (Davis, 1916 )
. The species has been reported from Texas and Mexico (
Metcalf 1963 b
,
Sanborn et al. 2005
). It has been collected in Nuevo León and Tamaulipas in Mexico (
Sanborn et al. 2005
).

Neocicada mediamexicana
Sanborn, 2005
. The species is known from the type series collected in Queretaro and San Luis Potosi (
Sanborn et al. 2005
).
